page.title: 12HOUSING RAFFORD AREA
page.content: The housing in our area is a mixture of old farmhouses and cottages and modern bungalows. The houses in the village are spread over quite a large area. There are many owner occupiers and only a few houses are rented.Most new houses are bungalows. The average number of rooms is 6,the maximum is 14 and the minimum is 3. Many of the new houses have central heating and solid fuel is most popular. Cooking is mainly done by electricity. Many of the older houses rely on open fires and wood is the most popular fuel. Only 1 house has solar heating panels. The largest house in the area is Blervie House which of Georgian style and has been empty for 9 years.
